string_char_at: You can use this function to return a specific character at a specific position within a string, with the index starting at 1 for the first character. If no character is found or the string is shorter than the value given to index, an empty string "" is returned.
The position to get the character from.
This will set <tt>str2</tt> to the seventh character ("H" counting as the 1st) in string <tt>str1</tt>, in this case "W".
